title: Ash Training Day 3
description: Understanding impulse moves, consolidation, expansion, and price delivery concepts.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• What defines a strong impulse move
• How consolidation relates to distribution/accumulation
• Expansion phase after compression
• Momentum shift signals
• Price delivery from level to level
• Reading the market's intention

quiz.question: What defines a strong impulse move?
quiz.explanation: Strong impulse moves are characterized by consecutive candles with large bodies in the direction of the trend.

quiz.question: Consolidation typically represents:
quiz.explanation: Consolidation phases represent either accumulation (before upMove) or distribution (before downMove).

quiz.question: Expansion follows:
quiz.explanation: Expansion typically follows a consolidation/compression phase, releasing the buildup of energy.

quiz.question: Momentum shift may signal:
quiz.explanation: Shift in momentum can indicate either trend continuation with renewed strength or a potential reversal.

quiz.question: Price delivery is:
options: Structured movement from level to level
quiz.explanation: Price moves in a structured manner from liquidity to liquidity, level to level, not randomly.
